data.name: Old Town Cemetery and site of town's East Academy
data.address: Southwest Corner of Mulberry and Green Streets

data.name: Lutheran and German Reform Church Chapel and Cemetery.
First Methodist Church Cemetery
data.description: the site of the earliest Methodist meeting house and subsequent chapels

data.name: Locust Grove African American Cemetery
data.address: Southeast Corner of Grove and Locust Streets

data.name: Green Hill Cemetery
data.address: Between Fairfax, Martin, Water, and Grove Streets

data.name: Stephen's log cabin
data.description: Approximate site of log home built by original settler Peter Stephens and his family circa 1732

data.name: St. John's Primitive Baptist Church
data.description: built in 1892 by African American Primitive Baptists

data.name: home of John Bell Tilden and Lewis Stephens Jr
data.description: Original home of Lewis Stephens Jr. and later home of John Bell Tilden, Methodist minister, veteran of the Revolutionary War, and physician. House named 'Bell Air'

data.name: Samuel Hull's Store
data.description: Samuel Hull's Store where note was posted by Major Harry Gilmor (CSA) warning that if Union General Hunter Burned the town Gilmor would kill the Union P.O.W. soldiers he held as captives. Also the location where Union Major Joseph K. Stearns of the 1st New York Lincoln Cavalry required the townspeople to sign the oath of allegiance to the Union government on June 1st 1864

data.name: Home of the Steele family
data.description: Home of the Steele family who acquired the property in 1847 and kept diaries during the Civil War

data.name: burned
data.description: Approximate site of Methodist parsonage burned by General Hunter's Union. Troops during May of 1864 due to misunderstanding about an attack on a Union wagon train

data.name: Market House
data.description: ite of the town's Market House that was torn down in 1833 to make way for the macadamized paving of the Valley Pike (U.S. Rt. 11)

data.name: Home of James Lemley
data.description: Home of James Lemley (1821-1899) who was a blacksmith and son of one of the town's most noted blacksmith/wagon makers - Site drawn by folk artist Frank Staling circa 1857

data.name: oldest standing house in town
data.description: Stone House - Possibly oldest standing house in town

data.name: Newtown History Center
data.description: Newtown History Center housed in 1819 Newtown Tavern/Hotel

data.name: City School
data.description: Old Stephen City School built in 1916

data.name: Toll House
data.address: South Side of Stephens Run on West Side of U.S. Rt. 11
data.description: Site of Nicewanger's Toll House drawn by folk artist Frank Staling circa 1857
